Articles.Content: Could anyone give me some help? I'm a bit clueless about reducing my computer's RAM use. I don't want anything too drastic (installing a solid-state drive or more RAM is where I draw the line). I have many files and appilcations that I do not use anymore, I run Windows Vista Home Premium SP2, Intel Core2 Duo 2.8GHz CPU.

I remember hearing about an application called Game-booster a year or so ago, i tried it myself but experiencing no noticeable improvement i stopped using it, i have heard some people swear by it's potency though, i think it works by shutting down any non-essential programs while you play.

Anyone else know if game-booster could help? I wouldn't use it on my recommendation alone as frankly i'm not the most knowledgeable on these things.
Gamebooster does not help unless your an idiot, and don't know how to use task manager. I just manually shut down unneeded tasks. Gamebooster actually uses more ram and cpu than it saves.
